page.title: 01Oxted & Tandridge
page.content: In Norman times{ Oxted }was a tiny village but now, in{1985,}it's a small busy town. The town is divided by a busy road, the A25 , which runs from {Sevenoaks to Guildford , }also linking with the{M25. }Oxted has direct rail & bus services to{London.} The town is surrounded by much farmland & woodland & many trees disguise the town from a distance. There is a great variation of soil , ranging from fine sandstone to stiff clay. Oxted has many types of {shops,}1{cinema,}1{library, }a{ health {centre,}a{station}& a{hospital.} Also there is the {Barn Theatre} where some very good plays are performed by a local dramatic society.{Hurst Green}is the Southern suburb of Oxted. Another B.R. Station serves the many commuters who live here but work in London. This block also contains{Tandridge village, several farms, & an oil well.
